Articles.Content: Been a while since I have played but I cannot return to a specific vessel from the tracking station. Last time I played I was able to return just fine, now I cannot

Can you elaborate?

Is the vessel not showing up in the tracker?

Is it showing up but not able to be selected?
Please submit bug reports and ask questions in the Gameplay Questions or Technical Support forums if you want people to help.

@skidkidd you will probably get better help over in the support sub forums. 

Are you unable to switch to other craft or is it just the one craft that causes problems?  As you say you're returning after a while, is this an older save (from a previous version) which you're using in the current version?  

Can you launch a new craft?  If you can launch, grab a copy of hyper-edit, launch a simple craft (just a probe core will do), open hyper-edit (alt-H) click orbit editor, select rendezvous, enter 0.2 for the lead time and select the vessel that you are unable to switch to.  Hit apply.  Either you will find yourself right next to your craft (and then you can switch with [ ]) or (if something is really wrong with that craft) the game may crash!  

If it does work, then I'd time warp a little and quicksave.  Then try to go back to the tracking station and see you can now switch to it like normal.  Not sure if that will work, but it might!

Moved to support, will assume mods as well.

The tracking station isn't bugged (except for viewing the resource overlay), it should work unless a mod is conflicting with it.

There are some craft you cannot access however, such as contract rescuees, you must get a vessel within 2.5km of them before they can be switched to.

On 1/23/2016 at 1:43 PM, katateochi said:

If it does work, then I'd time warp a little and quicksave.  Then try to go back to the tracking station and see you can now switch to it like normal.  Not sure if that will work, but it might!

I flew another rocket and docked with my station. Its no longer bugged. Thanks
